feed.subtitle: Weekly Trending of Emacs Lisp in GitHub

entry.title: ryanwersal/emacs-config
entry.summary:
Introduction

This is my new Emacs configuration (old one can be found here). It currently is still based largely on Justin Hipple's Emacs configuration but I am hoping it will trend towards becoming a relatively distinct config. As of late, a lot of inspiration has also been taken from Magnar Sveen's .emacs.d repo.

Why a new config?

There are a couple motivations for the new configuration. The largest was that for the past 6-8 months I have been using Sublime Text 2. It has mostly been a good experience except I have run into a handful of impactful performance issues largely related to installed plugins (I'm looking at you SublimeRope!) which were admittedly related to conditions outside their control.

Between that and my growing affection for Clojure (and probably Lisps in general), I've decided to "come back home" to Emacs.

Install

  1. Clone this repo as ~/.emacs.d
  2. Run git submodule update --init
  3. Launch Emacs and M-x list-packages, hit U then x to update the ELPA managed packages.
  4. Restart Emacs and you're set to go!

Helm

Using Helm on Windows requires installing Everything as per the wiki. I ended up having to download both the installer and the standalone es.exe. I just placed all of it in Everything's install directory, added that directory to the PATH, and everything was set.

Flycheck

Flycheck has numerous linters available. This config is currently setup to leverage only three though: python-flake8, emacs-lisp, and javascript-jshint.

  • python-flake8 will require you to install flake8 before it works.
  • Emacs-lisp works out of the box.
  • javascript-jshint requires installing jshint. You will need to have Node installed first.

entry.title: jlchen/emacs-for-clojure
entry.summary:
my own emacs configuration for clojure

emacs-for-clojure

my own emacs configuration for clojure, most copy from here, include this modules:

  • ac-nrepl
  • auto-complete
  • clojure-mode
  • nrepl
  • paredit
  • popup
  • rainbow-delimiters

Installation

just copy init.el to ~/.emacs.d/
